member.name: T:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaQuality
member.summary: Enumeration to denote the various quality levels of media

member.summary: Typically indicates less than 720p media quality

member.name: F:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaQuality.HighDefinition
member.summary: Typically indicates greater than or equal to 720p media quality

member.name: T:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.PlayerState
member.summary: Enum used to describe the player state. This is is different from the MediaState in that it indicates what stage of loading the media the player is in. Once the media is loaded, you should use CurrentState to examine the state of the media.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.PlayerState.Unloaded
member.summary: The player is unloaded, no source is set.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.PlayerState.Pending
member.summary: The source is set but the player is waiting to load the media due to AutoLoad=false

member.name: F:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.PlayerState.Loading
member.summary: The source is set and everything is ready to go but there are actions from the MediaLoading event that are still executing.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.PlayerState.Loaded
member.summary: The media has been loaded into the player but the media has not been opened yet.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.PlayerState.Opened
member.summary: The media has been loaded and opened. This happens immediately before MediaOpened fires.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.PlayerState.Starting
member.summary: The media has been told to start but there may be an async operation that needs to be performed first.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.PlayerState.Started
member.summary: The media has been started and is either playing or paused.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.PlayerState.Ending
member.summary: The media has finished playing and is in the process of ending. There may be async operations taking place now such as playing post roll ads.

member.name: F:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.PlayerState.Failed
member.summary: The media has failed and has been unloaded. You must set the source again on the player to load the media.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer
member.summary: Represents a media player used to play video or audio and optionally allow the user interact. This is the primary class in the Microsoft Media Platform Player Framework. This player offers a super-set of the MediaElement API. Optional plugins can be automatically detected to help extend or modify the default behavior.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.IncreasePlaybackRate
member.summary: Increases the PlaybackRate. When called, PlaybackRate will double until it reaches -1. Once it reaches -1, it will flip to positive numbers causing the player to fast forward.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.AutoLoadPlugins

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.TimeFormatConverter
member.summary: Gets or sets a an IValueConverter that is used to display the time to the user such as the position, duration, and time remaining. The default value applies the string format of "h\\:mm\\:ss".

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.DefaultTimeFormat
member.summary: The default TimeFormat string to use to display position, time remaining and duration.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.SkipBackInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of time in the video to skip back when the user selects skip back. This can be set to null to cause the skip back action to go back to the beginning. The default is 30 seconds although it will never go back past the beginning.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.DefaultSkipBackInterval
member.summary: The default SkipBackInterval value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.SkipAheadInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of time in the video to skip ahead when the user selects skip ahead. This can be set to null to cause the skip ahead action to go directly to the end. The default is 30 seconds although it will never go past the end (or MaxPosition if set).

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.DefaultSkipAheadInterval
member.summary: The default SkipAheadInterval value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.VisualMarkers
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of markers to be displayed in the timeline.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.Markers
member.summary: Gets the collection of timeline markers associated with the currently loaded media file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.AutoLoad
member.summary: Gets or sets a gate for loading the source. Setting this to false postpones any subsequent calls to the Source property and SetSource method. Once the source is set on the underlying MediaElement, the media begins to download. Note: There is another opportunity to block setting the source by using the awaitable BeforeMediaLoaded event.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.SignalStrength
member.summary: Gets or sets the signal strength used to indicate visually to the user the quality of the bitrate. This is only useful for adaptive streaming and is only displayed when IsSignalStrengthVisible = true

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.MediaQuality
member.summary: Gets or sets a an bool that is used to display the time to the user such as the position, duration, and time remaining. The default value applies the string format of "h\\:mm\\:ss".

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.LivePositionBuffer
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating what the tollerance is for determining whether or not the current position is live. IsPositionLive is affected by this property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.IsPositionLive
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating what the tollerance is for determining whether or not the current position is live. IsPositionLive is affected by this property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.LivePosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the Live position for realtime/live playback.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.Duration
member.summary: Gets or sets the duration of the current video or audio. For VOD, this is automatically set from the NaturalDuration property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.IsStartTimeOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the IsStartTimeOffset of the current video or audio. For VOD, this is automatically set from the NaturalIsStartTimeOffset property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.StartTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the StartTime of the current video or audio. For VOD, this is automatically set from the NaturalStartTime property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.EndTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the EndTime of the current media. For progressive video, this is automatically set from Duration - StartTime.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.TimeRemaining
member.summary: Gets the time remaining before the media will finish. This is calculated automatically whenever the Position or Duration properties change.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.SeekWhileScrubbing
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not the position should change while the user is actively scrubbing. If false, media will be paused until the user has finished scrubbing.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.ReplayOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of time to reset the current play position back for an instant replay. Default 5 seconds.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.SlowMotionPlaybackRate
member.summary: Gets or sets the playback rate when operating in slow motion (IsSlowMotion). Default .25

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.IsSlowMotion
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not the media is playing in slow motion. The slow motion playback rate is defined by the SlowMotionPlaybackRate property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.IsCaptionsActive
member.summary: Gets or sets if the player should show the captions configuration window.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.IsFullScreen
member.summary: Gets or sets if the player should indicate it is in fullscreen mode.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.AdvertisingState
member.summary: Gets or sets if the player should indicate it is in Advertising mode.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.IsScrubbing
member.summary: Gets whether or not the user is actively scrubbing.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.StartupPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the position at which to start the video at. This is useful for resuming videos at the place they were left off at.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.MediaEndedBehavior
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired behavior when the media reaches the end. Note: This will be ignored if IsLooping = true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.UpdateInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the interval that the timeline and other properties affected by the position will change.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.AvailableCaptions
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of captions that can be chosen by the user.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.SelectedCaption
member.summary: Gets or sets the selected caption stream.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.AvailableAudioStreams
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of AudioStreams that can be chosen by the user.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.SelectedAudioStream
member.summary: Gets or sets the selected AudioStream stream.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.IsLive
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the media is Live (vs. VOD).

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.MediaExtensionManager
member.summary: Gets or sets the MediaExtensionManager to be used by PlayerFramework plugins. One will be created on first use if it is not set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.AspectRatioWidth
member.summary: Gets the width portion of the media's native aspect ratio.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.AspectRatioHeight
member.summary: Gets the height portion of the media's native aspect ratio.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.AudioCategory
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that describes the purpose of the audio information in an audio stream.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.AudioDeviceType
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that describes the primary usage of the device that is being used to play back audio.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.PlayToSource
member.summary: Gets the information that is transmitted if the MediaElement is used for a "PlayTo" scenario.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.DefaultPlaybackRate
member.summary: Gets or sets the default playback rate for the media engine. The playback rate applies when the user is not using fast foward or reverse.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.IsAudioOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that describes whether the media source loaded in the media engine should seek to the start after reaching its end.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.AudioStreamCount
member.summary: Gets the number of audio streams available in the current media file. The default is 0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.AudioStreamIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the audio stream that plays along with the video component. The collection of audio streams is composed at run time and represents all audio streams available within the media file. The index can be unspecified, in which case the value is null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.AutoPlay
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether media will begin playback automatically when the Source property is set. Setting to false will still open, download and buffer the media but will pause on the first frame.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.BufferingProgress
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates the current buffering progress. The amount of buffering that is completed for media content. The value ranges from 0 to 1. Multiply by 100 to obtain a percentage.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.CanPause
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if media can be paused if the Pause() method is called.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.CanSeek
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if media can be repositioned by setting the value of the Position property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.Balance
member.summary: Gets or sets a ratio of volume across stereo speakers. The ratio of volume across speakers in the range between -1 and 1.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.DownloadProgress
member.summary: Gets a percentage value indicating the amount of download completed for content located on a remote server. The value ranges from 0 to 1. Multiply by 100 to obtain a percentage.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.DownloadProgressOffset
member.summary: Gets the offset of the download progress.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.IsMuted
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the audio is muted.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.NaturalDuration
member.summary: The natural duration of the media. The default value is Duration.Automatic, which is the value held if you query this property before MediaOpened.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.NaturalVideoHeight
member.summary: Gets the height of the video associated with the media. The height of the video that is associated with the media, in pixels. Audio files will return 0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.NaturalVideoWidth
member.summary: Gets the width of the video associated with the media. The width of the video associated with the media, in pixels. Audio files will return 0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.PlaybackRate

member.name: P:Microsoft.PlayerFramework.MediaPlayer.Position
